channel.title: Why doesn't Thunderbird go through Tor by default?
channel.description:
I think Thunderbird should go through Tor just like APT. While Kicksecure and Whonix both serve different design goals/purposes, I think other applications in Kicksecure should take advantage of using Tor by default like APT already is.
These "Apps" should be Kicksecure specific since if the same configuration were on the same Apps on Whonix WS it would cause issues like Tor over Tor or not working etc.

item.title: Why doesn't Thunderbird go through Tor by default?
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Not a project goal for Kicksecure. Elaborated here:

Kicksecure – 15 Oct 24

Privacy Goals and Non-Goals of Kicksecure

An overview of the privacy goals and non-goals of Kicksecure, emphasizing its focus on security over privacy and anonymity.

Using Kicksecure as a Whonix-Custom-Workstation is also not a project goal.

Whonix-Workstation is already based on Kicksecure. So there is very limited need for making Kicksecure more similar to Whonix.
